user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SocketBindAddress:
```c
int32 OS_SocketBindAddress(osal_id_t sock_id, const OS_SockAddr_t *Addr)
{
    OS_common_record_t *         record;
    OS_stream_internal_record_t *stream;
    OS_object_token_t            token;
    int32                        return_code;

    /* Check Parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(Addr);

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_EXCLUSIVE, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, sock_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        record = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_global_stream_table, token);
        stream = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_stream_table, token);

        if (stream->socket_domain == OS_SocketDomain_INVALID)
        {
            /* Not a socket */
            return_code = OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_TYPE;
        }
        else if ((stream->stream_state & (OS_STREAM_STATE_BOUND | OS_STREAM_STATE_CONNECTED)) != 0)
        {
            /* Socket must be neither bound nor connected */
            return_code = OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_STATE;
        }
        else
        {
            return_code = OS_SocketBindAddress_Impl(&token, Addr);

            if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
            {
                OS_CreateSocketName(&token, Addr, NULL);
                record->name_entry = stream->stream_name;
                stream->stream_state |= OS_STREAM_STATE_BOUND;
            }
        }

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
return_code = OS_SocketBindAddress_Impl(&token, Addr);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment: Addr is declared as const OS_SockAddr_t * and is passed unchanged to OS_SocketBindAddress_Impl. This conforms to Rule 8.13 provided that the prototype of OS_SocketBindAddress_Impl accepts a pointer-to-const (e.g. const OS_SockAddr_t *). A violation would occur if OS_SocketBindAddress_Impl were declared to take a non-const pointer (e.g. OS_SockAddr_t *Addr), since that would discard the const qualifier when passing Addr and thus violate Rule 8.13 (and produce a qualifier-discarding conversion).
